newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen heading higher before Fed meeting.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen heading higher before Fed meeting.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to move higher at the start of trading on Tuesday as the market gears up for the outcome of a meeting of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).
Analysts expect the FOMC, the central bank's policy arm, to raise interest rates at its meeting on Tuesday. News is expected at about 1900 GMT.
Analysts said they expected some followthrough at the start from Monday's 100-point rally in the Dow industrials.

"Almost everyone has built in a rate hike of 25-basis points," said Peter Cardillo, director of research at Westfalia Investments. "The surprise will be if there the Federal Reserve does not hike interest rates."
